instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: N2 interface connection failure;SCTP link down; IP route misconfigured; gNB IP mismatch
output: Check SCTP connection on N2 (NGAP); verify IP addresses and port 36412; coordinate with RAN to re-establish link

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Missing Initial UE message from gNB;N2 signaling lost due to network congestion; NGAP message dropped; gNB misrouting
output: Capture NGAP packets on N2; check for packet loss or delay; ensure correct gNB targeting of AMF

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NAS signaling failure during registration;Corrupted NAS message; UE-AMF cipher mismatch; NAS protocol version issue
output: Examine AMF NAS logs; verify security algorithms compatibility; have UE reattempt registration after resetting

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Authentication failure for UE;AUSF not reachable; invalid subscriber credentials; AKA sync failure
output: Verify AUSF connectivity (N8); check subscriber key and OPC in UDM; perform AKA re-synchronization if needed

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Security mode command rejected;UE doesn't support required ciphering/integrity algorithm; key mismatch; NAS integrity check failure
output: Negotiate a compatible security algorithm; check UE capability info; attempt re-authentication if needed

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Registration rejected due to no available network slice;Requested S-NSSAI not configured in core; NSSF returned no candidate slice; subscriber not authorized for slice
output: Check NSSF slice configuration and UE subscription; add missing slice info or advise UE to use a valid slice

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: AMF overload condition triggered;High signaling volume (mass UE registrations); CPU resource exhaustion; memory saturation
output: Activate AMF overload control features; scale out AMF instances; redistribute UE load or optimize signaling

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: AMF application crash;Software bug in AMF service; unhandled exception under specific call flow; memory leak leading to restart
output: Collect AMF crash logs/core dump; apply latest Ericsson patch for AMF; consider rolling back recent update or restarting node

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: AMF-SMF communication failure (N11 timeout);SMF not responding to AMF requests; HTTP/2 SBI interface issue; AMF or SMF service hung
output: Verify SMF status and logs; ensure AMF-SMF service endpoints registered in NRF; investigate HTTP timeout cause

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Subscription data fetch failure;UDM not responding to AMF query; Nudm interface credentials issue; subscriber data missing in UDM
output: Check UDM health and connectivity; verify Nudm configuration (URI; certs); ensure subscriber is provisioned in UDM

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Periodic registration update failure;AMF timer misconfiguration; UE not responding to periodic update requests; context retention issue
output: Verify periodic registration timer values; check if UE enters unreachable state; adjust timer settings or force re-registration

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Stale UE context not cleared on AMF;Previous deregistration not fully processed; AMF software bug preventing context release
output: Manually remove or purge stale UE context via O&M; apply fix to AMF software for proper context release; monitor for recurrences

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Duplicate 5G-GUTI assigned to UEs;AMF identity allocation algorithm fault; race condition in AMF cluster; software bug causing GUTI collision
output: Check AMF logs for GUTI allocation issues; restart or isolate problematic AMF instance; update software to fix the bug

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Inter-AMF context transfer failure;Target AMF not reachable or rejecting context; network issue between AMFs; slice relocation logic error
output: Verify connectivity between AMF regions; ensure target AMF is operational and slice-configured; allow UE to re-register if transfer fails

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Memory exhaustion on AMF instance;Memory leak in AMF service; too many active UE contexts without cleanup; known issue in current release
output: Monitor AMF memory usage; restart AMF service to reclaim memory; plan upgrade to fixed software version

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: High CPU utilization impacting AMF signaling;Excessive signaling load; inefficient message processing due to bug; lack of CPU resources on VM
output: Profile AMF CPU usage to identify bottleneck; increase CPU allocation or instance count; optimize configuration or update software

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: AMF configuration mismatch with RAN;Tracking area code or PLMN ID mismatch between gNB and AMF; network name configuration error
output: Align configuration: update AMF with correct TAC/PLMN info; ensure gNB broadcast and AMF expected values match; resync configuration via O&M

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: AMF VM migration caused transient outage;Live migration or restart of AMF container/VM; state not seamlessly transferred; brief loss of service during failover
output: Check cloud infrastructure logs for VM events; configure proper redundancy (e.g.; active-active AMFs); adjust migration strategy to minimize impact

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: AMF not registered in NRF;AMF failed to register its NF profile after boot; certificate or API issue with NRF; configuration error in service registration
output: Verify AMF's NF registration logs; ensure NRF is reachable and credentials are correct; re-register AMF service and check NRF for entry

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: SBI interface TLS handshake failure (AMF);SSL/TLS certificate expired or not trusted; AMF and peer (e.g.; AUSF/SMF) cannot establish secure connection
output: Renew or install correct certificates on AMF and peers; verify trust store configuration; attempt connection again after cert update

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: UE paging failure (AMF did not page UE);AMF lost track of UE location; paging message not sent due to internal error; incorrect registration area info
output: Check AMF paging logs; ensure UE's last known cell is in AMF's tracking area list; correct any TA list misconfigurations and re-test

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Forbidden PLMN registration reject;UE attempting registration on a PLMN not allowed by core config; subscription restricts roaming on this network
output: Verify PLMN allowlist/denylist in AMF configuration; update subscriber roaming permissions in UDM if needed; advise UE to use permitted PLMN

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Service Request failure for idle UE;AMF did not have context (due to improper release); UE used outdated 5G-GUTI; missing UE context after idle mode
output: Force UE re-registration; ensure AMF properly retains context or uses registration area update; check if context was prematurely dropped

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Network slicing information mismatch;Slice information in UE request doesn't match any configured S-NSSAI in AMF; possible UE configuration error or outdated slice list
output: Update slice configurations if needed; confirm UE is requesting a valid slice; if UE misconfigured; advise to update slice settings

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Excessive deregistration requests observed;Network instability causing many UEs to deregister; possible bug causing repeated deregistration; malicious UE behavior
output: Analyze deregistration patterns in AMF logs; if bug; apply fix or workaround; if external cause; stabilize network or identify offending UEs

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: PDU session establishment failure;DNN not configured or allowed; missing network slice support; SMF selection error
output: Verify requested DNN/S-NSSAI is configured in SMF; check subscriber's allowed DNN/slice in UDM; correct configuration and retry

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: PFCP association with UPF failed;UPF not reachable (down or IP mismatch); firewall blocking N4 port; certificate issue (if PFCP TLS)
output: Check UPF status and connectivity (ping N4 IP); ensure PFCP port is open and matching; correct IP config on SMF and re-initiate association

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: PFCP session establishment error;UPF returned error (no resources or unknown configuration); TEID allocation mismatch; unsupported PFCP IE by UPF
output: Review SMF and UPF logs for PFCP cause; confirm UPF has capacity and proper config; adjust SMF PFCP parameters or upgrade UPF if needed

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Policy control (N7) interface failure;PCF not responding or offline; N7 HTTP endpoint misconfigured; TLS handshake failure between SMF and PCF
output: Ensure PCF service is up; verify N7 interface URL and ports in SMF configuration; check certificate trust between SMF and PCF

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Delayed response from SMF to AMF;SMF processing is slow due to high load; internal thread contention; garbage collection pause (in cloud-native SMF)
output: Check SMF CPU and memory usage; scale out or load balance SMF instances; tune performance (e.g.; adjust GC or thread settings); ensure no blocking bug

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: PDU session release incomplete;SMF failed to delete session context; PFCP session not cleared on UPF; signaling message lost during release
output: Manually remove lingering session via SMF CLI or O&M; sync with UPF to clear PFCP state; apply software fix if known issue in release

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: QoS rule update failure;Requested QoS not supported by UPF or radio; PCF provided conflicting QoS parameters; SMF-QoS mapping error
output: Review QoS (5QI) settings in PCF policy and SMF; adjust to supported values; ensure UPF and gNB support the QoS profile; resend update

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: SMF service in overload state;Too many simultaneous session requests; possible signaling storm or misbehaving device; resource limits reached
output: Enable overload control on SMF (throttle new sessions); investigate source of sudden load; expand capacity or deploy additional SMF instances

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: SMF application crash;Software defect in SMF triggered by specific sequence; memory corruption issue; known bug in current SMF release
output: Analyze core dump and SMF logs; check for known bugs (Ericsson release notes); upgrade to a patched SMF version or apply hotfix

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: SMF configuration error (DNN mapping);Requested DNN not mapped to any UPF; SMF missing configuration for that APN/DNN; provisioning oversight
output: Update SMF configuration to include the DNN and its corresponding UPF; sync configuration with UDM subscription data; test with UE again

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Subscriber session data retrieval failed;SMF cannot fetch subscriber session profile from UDM; Nudm query timed out; subscription info missing (no 5G data plan)
output: Ensure UDM is reachable and responding; verify subscriber has 5G service data provisioned; correct any missing data and reattempt session setup

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Charging function interface error;SMF unable to report to CHF (Nchf) due to connectivity or config issue; CHF endpoint down; missing charging subscription
output: Check CHF service status; verify SMF Nchf client configuration (URL/credentials); use interim offline charging if applicable until resolved; restore CHF connectivity

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: No UPF available for selected slice/DNN;All UPF instances serving slice are down or overloaded; SMF slice-to-UPF mapping not configured; NSSF/NRF info outdated
output: Bring up an available UPF for the slice or re-route to alternate UPF; update SMF's slice mapping configuration; refresh NRF info and retry

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Duplicate IP address allocated to UE;IP pool mismanagement by SMF; stale entry not cleared upon last release; lack of sync in distributed IP allocation
output: Audit SMF IP address pool for conflicts; clear or reclaim IP of terminated sessions; implement IP pool synchronization or use UDM/UDR for centralized allocation

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: PFCP heartbeat timeout - UPF marked down;Periodic PFCP keepalive from UPF not received; network latency or packet loss; UPF process hang
output: Check connectivity and latency between SMF and UPF; restart or failover the UPF if unresponsive; adjust PFCP timer if necessary to account for network conditions

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: SMF selection failure by AMF;AMF could not find an appropriate SMF via NRF (no response or no matching profile); SMF not registered for requested slice or DNN
output: Ensure SMF is registered in NRF with correct slice/DNN info; update SMF's NF profile as needed; verify NSSF is providing correct guidance to AMF

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: SMF license capacity reached;Number of active PDU sessions exceeds licensed limit; license not updated for expansion; improper license configuration
output: Obtain or activate additional license capacity for SMF; reduce session load or disconnect idle sessions; plan capacity expansion in licensing

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: SMF state database error;Issue with SMF's internal database or UDR for session context; database cluster node down; data inconsistency
output: Verify database (UDR/Cassandra etc.) status; failover to backup DB node; reconcile any data inconsistency; ensure SMF can access its data store

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: SMF network configuration error;SMF using incorrect IP or VLAN for N4 or N7 interface; routing issue in SMF host network; misconfigured interface parameters
output: Check SMF network settings and routing tables; correct IP addresses or VLAN tags; ensure connectivity on all SMF interfaces (N4; N7; N11)

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: PFCP message decoding error;SMF received malformed PFCP message from UPF; possible software bug or version incompatibility; unexpected IE in message
output: Capture PFCP messages for analysis; verify UPF and SMF software versions compatibility; apply patches or configure SMF to ignore unknown IEs

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: SMF not releasing resources after handover;UE moved to new AMF/SMF but old SMF kept session; context transfer failed; bug in inter-SMF procedure
output: Manually remove stale session from old SMF; investigate inter-SMF handover logs; ensure proper configuration for context transfer or use full re-establishment

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: PDU Session modification failure;SMF unable to modify session (e.g.; add QoS flow) due to PCF error or UPF limitation; message sequence issue
output: Check PCF provided policy for the modification; ensure UPF supports requested change (e.g.; additional QFI); attempt modification again or release and re-establish session if needed

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Inactive session purge malfunction;SMF's periodic cleanup of idle sessions not functioning; stale sessions accumulating; potential memory leak or timer bug
output: Review SMF timer settings for inactive session cleanup; clear out known stale sessions via admin command; update SMF software if this is a known cleanup bug

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: SMF to AMF feedback error on release;SMF failed to send release complete to AMF; message lost or process crash during release; AMF waiting for confirm that never arrives
output: Check SMF logs for release procedure; ensure SMF is stable and can send final messages; if a crash occurred; consider patching; AMF should timeout and clean up if no response

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Mismatched session context between SMF instances;In a clustered environment; SMF instances not sharing state correctly; session data not replicated; load balancer misrouted messages
output: Ensure SMF cluster state synchronization is functioning (if stateless design; check external store); fix load balancer configuration so a single session's messages go to one SMF; possibly enable sticky sessions

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Lost PFCP association with SMF;SMF unreachable on N4 interface; SMF service down or restarted; network connectivity issue causing missed heartbeat
output: Check SMF status and network connectivity; attempt to re-establish PFCP session; if persistent; investigate for SMF failover or network block

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: GTP-U tunnel down (N3 interface failure);gNB not receiving GTP-U packets; TEID mismatch between gNB and UPF; firewall or routing issue on N3 path
output: Verify TEID and IP configuration for N3 tunnel on both gNB and UPF; ensure no firewall is blocking GTP (UDP/2152); re-establish the GTP-U tunnel

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: High packet loss on N3 interface;Backhaul network congestion; packet drops at intermediate router; MTU mismatch causing fragmentation loss
output: Monitor N3 interface traffic for errors; coordinate with transport network to alleviate congestion; set consistent MTU across gNB and UPF interfaces

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: N6 interface down (no connectivity to data network);Physical link or port failure; switch/router issue in data network; misconfigured VLAN or IP on N6 interface
output: Check physical link status and port configurations; restore connectivity or switch to backup link if available; validate N6 interface IP and VLAN settings

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: No route to external data network;Missing route in UPF routing table for the Data Network; default gateway not set; routing protocol (e.g.; BGP) session down
output: Add or correct routes on the UPF for the affected data network; verify default gateway and routing protocol status; re-establish any dynamic routing sessions

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: UPF packet processing delay (overload);Traffic volume exceeds UPF capacity; insufficient CPU or I/O throughput; potential DDoS or abnormal traffic patterns
output: Scale out user plane by deploying additional UPF instances; ensure adequate CPU/DPDK resources on servers; implement traffic shaping or DDoS protection

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: UPF memory leak causing performance degradation;Software bug in forwarding plane leaking memory; heavy traffic triggering unfreed buffers; memory usage rising over time
output: Monitor UPF memory usage; restart UPF service periodically as a workaround; apply vendor patch to fix memory leak in UPF software

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: UPF process crash;software error (e.g.; null pointer) in user plane code; unhandled exception when processing certain packets; known bug in current release
output: Gather core dump and crash logs from UPF; open a case with Ericsson if known issue; upgrade to stable software release or apply hotfix

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: QoS rules not applied on user traffic;UPF failed to install QER (QoS Enforcement Rule); configuration mismatch between SMF and UPF on QoS profile; software issue ignoring QoS parameters
output: Verify that PFCP messages contain correct QoS parameters; check UPF logs for rule installation; ensure UPF build supports QoS feature; reapply policy or restart UPF

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Intermittent traffic drops on N6;Flapping link to data network; output interface errors (CRC/faulty cable); buffer overflow under peak traffic
output: Inspect N6 interface error counters; replace or repair physical link if errors found; increase buffer or rate-limit bursts to stabilize traffic

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: GTP-U error indications from gNB;gNB reporting unknown TEID or GTP-U packet loss; UPF may have lost session state (PFCP session not found); out-of-sync tunnel info
output: Check UPF for presence of the indicated TEID/session; if missing; possibly the UPF restarted and lost state; re-establish the session by triggering UE reattach or handover procedure

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: PFCP sequence number mismatch;Out-of-order PFCP messages due to network reordering; lost response causing SMF to resend with new seq#; software handling issue
output: Analyze PFCP message logs for sequence irregularities; ensure network QoS for control traffic; update UPF/SMF software if known PFCP sequencing bug exists

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Encapsulation format error;Mismatch in expected protocol (IPv4 vs IPv6) between SMF and UPF; incorrect GTP-U header formation due to config bug
output: Verify PDU Session type (IPv4/IPv6) agreed between UE and network; check UPF encapsulation settings; correct any config or apply patch to fix GTP-U formatting

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NAT table capacity exceeded;Too many concurrent flows causing NAT entries to max out; long timeouts keeping stale entries; potential DDoS creating excessive connections
output: Increase NAT table size or shorten timeout for idle flows; clear non-essential NAT entries; implement connection rate limiting or add another UPF to share load

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Multi-UPF path switch failure;Failure in establishing new user plane route during mobility (anchor UPF to local UPF switch); PFCP signaling between UPFs failed; new path config error
output: Check N9 interface connectivity and PFCP sessions between UPFs; ensure target UPF is configured to accept handover; verify SMF instructions for path switch; if fail; fall back to anchoring at original UPF

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Traffic not matching any PDR (dropped);SMF did not configure a Packet Detection Rule for a particular flow; unexpected traffic (e.g.; new protocol/port) not covered by existing rules; PDR config bug
output: Review PDR/FAR configurations on UPF for active sessions; if legitimate traffic is being dropped; update SMF rules to include that traffic; deploy fix if PDR installation is incomplete due to a bug

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: UPF server network interface failure;Physical NIC or driver failure on UPF host; loss of connectivity on one interface due to hardware fault; link down on interface
output: Move traffic to redundant interface if available; replace or reset the faulty NIC; ensure network redundancy to avoid single point of failure

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Overlay network issue impacting UPF connectivity;In cloud deployment; VXLAN/overlay misconfiguration leading to packet drop; MTU issues causing fragmentation in overlay; virtual switch problem
output: Check cloud network settings (VXLAN IDs; MTU) for UPF communication paths; adjust MTU or fragmentation settings; work with cloud admin to resolve any virtual network misconfigurations

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: UPF CPU utilization at 100%;Extremely high packet forwarding load; lack of hardware acceleration usage; potential infinite loop or heavy processing from a rogue flow
output: Enable hardware acceleration or DPDK if not already; identify if a specific flow is causing abnormal load and block if needed; add more CPU cores or spin up additional UPF instance to share traffic

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: UPF to DN encryption issue;If IPsec is used on N6; encryption tunnel failure; key exchange issue or expired SA; misconfigured IPsec policy
output: Check IPsec/IKE logs if applicable; refresh or renegotiate keys; ensure both ends have matching encryption policies and valid certificates/PSKs

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Misordered packets causing jitter;Parallel routing paths for user plane causing out-of-order delivery; load balancing across multiple links without preservation of order; buffer mismanagement
output: Ensure flows are not split across paths that don't maintain order; implement sequence restoration if needed; coordinate with transport network to adjust load balancing configuration

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: UPF configuration rollback failure;After a config change attempt (e.g.; new PDR rules); the rollback did not restore previous state properly; partial config left in UPF
output: Perform a fresh configuration push from O&M; if UPF supports transaction rollbacks; investigate why it failed; possibly restart UPF to clear partial config

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Inconsistent usage reporting;UPF usage report (URR) values not resetting or accumulating incorrectly; bug in usage reporting function; misaligned reporting intervals between SMF and UPF
output: Check URR configuration in SMF for the affected session; reset the usage counters by releasing session if needed; update UPF software if usage report bug is known

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: User plane packet duplication;Misconfiguration causing two UPFs to forward the same traffic; duplication in a mirrored traffic setup; SMF mistakenly established two routes for one session
output: Check SMF PFCP rules to ensure only one forwarding path per session; verify no testing or mirroring mode is enabled unintentionally; remove any duplicate rules in UPF configuration

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Dropped packets due to DPI/Firewall function;Internal DPI or firewall feature in UPF blocking traffic; policy configured to drop certain content (like disallowed websites or protocols); possibly false positive detection
output: Review UPF content filtering/DPI logs to identify why packets are dropped; adjust policy to allow legitimate traffic; if not needed; disable overly restrictive firewall rules in UPF

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NRF service not responding;NRF application is down or hung; container crash; network connectivity loss to NRF host
output: Restart the NRF service or pod; check logs for crash clues; ensure the host or VM running NRF is reachable and not overloaded

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Slow NF discovery responses (NRF overload);High volume of registration/discovery requests; NRF under-provisioned; possible infinite registration loop from misbehaving NF
output: Scale out NRF instances or increase CPU/memory; identify any NF re-registering excessively; implement rate limiting or fix NF causing load

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NRF database access failure;Backend database (UDR or internal DB) for NRF is down or unreachable; DB connection string misconfigured; DB credentials invalid
output: Verify DB server status and network connectivity; check NRF configuration for correct DB info; restore DB service or switch to backup

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NF registration to NRF failed;Network function provided incorrect credentials or API endpoint; certificate issue blocking NF registration; NF not configured with proper NRF address
output: Confirm NF (e.g.; SMF/AMF) has correct NRF API URL and credentials; ensure NF's TLS certificate is trusted by NRF; correct config and retry registration

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NF discovery returned no results;NRF has no record of the requested NF type (e.g.; PCF) in given network slice; NF never registered or has deregistered; filter parameters (slice ID; etc.) mismatch
output: Verify that the target NF (service) is registered in NRF and active; if filter used; ensure it matches NF's profile (e.g.; correct slice info); update NF registration if needed

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NRF certificate expired;The TLS certificate used by NRF for SBI interfaces has expired or been revoked; NFs refuse to connect due to untrusted certificate
output: Install a new valid certificate for NRF; update trust anchors on all NFs if necessary; verify NFs can successfully establish secure connection post-update

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Incomplete NF profile in NRF;During registration; NF didn't send all required details (e.g.; missing endpoint info or slice support); potential bug in NF registration logic; NRF stored partial info
output: Have the NF (e.g.; UPF) re-register and ensure all profile data is included; check NF software for known issues in NF profile advertisement; update or patch as needed

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NRF cluster inconsistency (data not synced);Multiple NRF instances not sharing the same database or cache; network partition between NRF nodes; inconsistent NF records across cluster
output: Restore connectivity between NRF nodes; ensure a single source of truth for NF registration data (common DB or sync service); merge and clean up any duplicate or stale entries

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Stale NF entries present;NFs that went down did not deregister (e.g.; crash without deregistration); NRF still shows them as active; could mislead discovery
output: Purge or mark stale NF instances in NRF (via TTL expiry or manual cleanup); configure NFs to deregister on shutdown; shorten heartbeat or registration renewal interval if needed

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NRF memory leak observed;NRF application gradually consuming more memory over time; likely a software bug in handling registrations or discovery requests; eventually causes performance issues
output: Monitor memory usage trend; schedule periodic restarts of NRF as a workaround; apply vendor patch addressing the memory leak in the NRF service

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Incompatible NRF API version;An NF is using a different 3GPP API version than NRF (e.g.; NF at v1.1 vs NRF at v1.2); version check failed and NF cannot register or discover
output: Enable backward compatibility on NRF if available; upgrade the NF to a compatible API version; ensure all NFs and NRF follow same 3GPP API release version

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Firewall blocking NRF access;Security rules preventing NFs from reaching NRF on required port (e.g.; 443); newly deployed NRF instance IP not whitelisted; on-prem firewall misconfigured
output: Update firewall or security group to allow traffic between NFs and NRF on the SBI ports; verify connectivity via ping/telnet; ensure any IP changes are reflected in rules

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Excessive NF registration attempts;Misconfigured NF repeatedly registering (perhaps due to crash loop); short NF keep-alive interval causing frequent refresh; bug causing NF to not recognize its already registered
output: Identify the NF making excessive requests (via logs or NF type); fix the NF configuration or stability issue; increase registration validity period if too short; temporarily block the NF if needed to stabilize NRF

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NRF internal processing timeout;NRF took too long to respond to a request (possibly due to slow DB query or code deadlock); internal timeout triggered for the operation
output: Examine NRF logs for slow query or timeouts; optimize database (add indexes or tune query); consider scaling the database or splitting load; patch NRF if known deadlock issue

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NRF disk usage at capacity;NRF log files or database files filled the storage; old NF records or traces not purged; cleanup not configured
output: Clear out or archive old log files; increase disk allocation for NRF; configure log rotation and database retention policies to prevent recurrence

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NRF returned HTTP 500 error to NF;Unhandled exception in NRF on processing request; possible null pointer or data issue; NF request triggered an unexpected error path
output: Check NRF application logs for stack trace; identify the NF request causing it; work around by adjusting NF query if possible; escalate to R&D for a fix in NRF code

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NRF misrouting within cluster;Load balancer or DNS misconfiguration sends NF requests to an inactive NRF instance; sticky session not maintained; causing context issues
output: Verify NRF cluster load balancing configuration (e.g.; Kubernetes service endpoints or DNS SRV records); remove any offline nodes from rotation; ensure consistent response routing

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Invalid NF profile data causing parse error;NF registered with an attribute value outside expected range or format; e.g.; extremely long strings or invalid characters in NF profile; parsing bug in NRF
output: Identify the offending NF profile (check NRF logs to see which NF caused parse failure); correct the NF's configuration if possible; patch NRF to handle or sanitize unexpected data better

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NRF connectivity intermittent;Network instability or flapping link between some NFs and NRF; possibly due to route changes or interface issues; leads to sporadic registration failures
output: Check network path (trace route) from affected NF to NRF; monitor for packet loss; fix any unstable link or routing issue; consider dual-homing NFs to improve reliability

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Secondary NRF not updated after primary failure;Failover to backup NRF occurred but some NF registrations didn't carry over; maybe not using shared DB or the sync was delayed; NFs are pointing to old primary only
output: Ensure high availability setup for NRF uses shared state (or rapid sync); configure NFs to have list of NRF endpoints (primary & secondary); manually sync or re-register NF if needed after failover

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Unauthorized NF registration attempt;An NF trying to register with incorrect credentials or from an IP not allowed; possibly a rogue or test NF not recognized; NRF rejecting with 403
output: Verify the identity and credentials of the NF; if legitimate; update NRF trust list or credentials; if rogue; block the source and investigate why it attempted registration

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NRF service configuration error;NRF config (yaml) incorrectly set after an update; e.g.; wrong binding address or service name; causing NFs to not find services; config map not applied properly
output: Review NRF configuration files for errors; correct parameters like service names; ports; etc.; apply corrected configuration and restart; notify NFs or update DNS if addresses changed

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NRF not reachable due to DNS resolution failure;NFs use FQDN to reach NRF but DNS entry is missing or misconfigured; recent IP change not updated in DNS; DNS server issues
output: Test NRF hostname resolution from NF environment; update DNS records or hosts file with correct NRF IP; ensure DNS propagation; as a workaround; configure NFs with temporary IP if needed

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Inconsistent service naming causing discovery issues;NF registered service name that doesn't exactly match what other NFs request (e.g.; 'nudm-subscriberdata' vs 'nudm-subscription'); might be due to case or spelling differences
output: Standardize service names in all NF configurations according to 3GPP spec and Ericsson guidelines; correct any mismatched names in NF config and re-register; if needed; use NRF aliasing feature if available

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NRF excessive logging impacting performance;Debug logging left enabled in production; writing large logs on every request; I/O wait slowing down responses
output: Adjust logging level to normal (info/warning) in NRF configuration; archive or truncate existing large logs; monitor performance improvement after log level change

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: PCF service down;Policy server process stopped or crashed; out-of-memory error; unplanned restart
output: Restart the PCF service or instance; analyze crash dump if available; ensure backup PCF instance takes over policy duties in the meantime

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: N7 interface misconfiguration;PCF listening on wrong port/URI for N7; SMF using incorrect endpoint; mismatched API version causing handshake failure
output: Verify PCF's N7 service endpoint configuration (URI; port); correct SMF configuration to point to PCF; update API versions or enable backward compatibility as needed

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Policy decision error returned;PCF unable to find applicable policy for UE/slice; missing policy rule; internal error in decision engine
output: Check PCF logs for error details; ensure policy rules exist for the subscriber's plan and slice/DNN; if internal error; consider PCF service restart or patch

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: PCF-UDR interface failure;PCF cannot retrieve policy data from UDR database; UDR not reachable or query times out; data store credentials invalid
output: Ensure UDR (policy store) is up and responding; verify PCF has correct UDR connection settings; reconnect or failover to backup UDR; check for data consistency

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Invalid QoS parameters in policy;PCF provided QoS values outside allowed range (e.g.; unsupported 5QI or ARP); configuration mistake in policy rules; bug in PCF translation of policy
output: Audit the policy rule configurations for QoS settings; adjust values to supported range; test with sample UE to ensure SMF accepts the policy; update PCF software if this is a known issue

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Missing charging information in policy;Policy rule lacks required charging ID or rating group for the session; integration with CHF not configured; subscriber profile incomplete
output: Update policy configuration to include necessary charging parameters; ensure PCF-CHF interface is configured if needed; sync subscriber policy profile from BSS/OSS

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: PCF under heavy load (overload);Large number of simultaneous policy requests (e.g.; after outage recovery); complex policies causing high CPU usage; insufficient hardware resources allocated
output: Scale out PCF instances or allocate more CPU/memory; simplify policy logic if possible to reduce processing per request; ensure load balancing of requests across PCF instances

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: PCF application crash;Unhandled exception in policy engine code; edge-case input causing crash; memory leak leading to OOM and restart
output: Examine PCF logs around time of crash for clues; apply any available patches for stability; restart PCF and monitor; have a secondary PCF handle requests during primary outage

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Outdated policy cached;PCF using an older version of policy data (cached) that doesn't reflect recent changes; subscriber moved to new plan but cache not refreshed; sync delay
output: Clear or refresh PCF cache for policy data; ensure PCF fetches latest rules from UDR or internal DB; implement event-triggered updates on policy changes to keep PCF in sync

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: PCF configuration error after upgrade;Some config parameters not migrated properly during software upgrade; feature toggles or endpoints not set correctly; leading to partial functionality
output: Review PCF configuration files and compare with previous version; correct any discrepancies (e.g.; missing feature flags); test policy retrieval and enforcement thoroughly post-fix

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: SMF-PCF version incompatibility;SMF and PCF are on different 3GPP release levels causing API mismatches; e.g.; SMF expecting an attribute that PCF (older) doesn't provide
output: Align software versions of SMF and PCF to a common release; or apply compatibility patches; if upgrade not immediate; configure SMF to accept partial info or use default values

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Aggressive rate limiting by PCF;PCF's built-in throttling thinks there are too many requests and starts rejecting or delaying them; threshold set too low for network size
output: Adjust PCF rate limiting or throttling configuration to match expected peak loads; monitor to ensure PCF isn't over-throttling; if due to bug; update to fix throttle behavior

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Conflicting policy rules for user;Two or more policies applicable to a subscriber or slice with overlapping conditions resulting in conflict; e.g.; one allows service; another denies
output: Examine the policy rule set for overlapping conditions; adjust priorities or merge rules to eliminate conflict; test the resulting policy decision for the subscriber to ensure correctness

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: No default policy applied;Subscriber does not match any specific policy and PCF had no default fallback rule; oversight in policy configuration; PCF returns error or empty policy
output: Define a default policy rule in PCF for cases where no specific rule matches (e.g.; basic internet access with default QoS); deploy this configuration and rerun scenario

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: PCF memory leak suspected;Increasing memory usage with each policy decision request; possibly due to not freeing policy objects; known memory bug in current PCF build
output: Monitor PCF memory over time; if leak is confirmed; schedule regular restarts to avoid crash; upgrade to a version where the memory leak is fixed

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: PCF high response latency;PCF taking long time to return policy (hundreds of ms); could be complex internal logic or slowness in retrieving data from UDR; maybe CPU starvation
output: Profile the PCF to pinpoint delay (logic vs data access); optimize policy rules or partition into simpler components; ensure PCF host has adequate CPU and not throttling; if UDR is slow; consider caching data in PCF

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Policy not enforcing application filtering as expected;PCF policy supposed to block/allow certain application (5-tuple) but not working; maybe SMF/UPF didn't apply the rule or PCF didn't include it properly
output: Confirm that PCF sends the expected application filter in PCC rule to SMF; check UPF PDRs for the filter; if missing; troubleshoot PCF rule config; ensure SMF and UPF support application detection if required (DPI)

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: PCF license limit reached;Number of concurrent policy sessions or managed subscribers exceeds PCF license; new sessions are rejected by PCF beyond this limit
output: Verify license allowance for PCF and current usage; contact Ericsson to extend license if needed; consider distributing load to additional PCF instance if license is per instance

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Policy counters not resetting;Usage counters (for data or time quotas) in PCF not resetting at cycle or after session release; likely software bug or incorrect configuration of quota
output: Check configuration for policy counter reset intervals; if bug; manually reset affected counters via O&M or restart PCF component; apply patch from vendor if available

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: PCF cluster configuration mismatch;In multi-node PCF deployment; one node has different config or policy set than another; possibly not synchronized after an update; leads to inconsistent decisions
output: Ensure all PCF nodes are using the same configuration and policy repository; synchronize policy databases; if needed; take out-of-sync node offline until it is updated

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: PCF connectivity issue to AMF (UE policy association);If PCF is also used for UE policy control and interacts with AMF (UE-AM policy); the SBI connection might fail; perhaps wrong Nudr or Naf configuration
output: Verify PCF's ability to reach AMF/UDM for access policies if applicable; correct any URI or port issues; ensure proper service registration in NRF for these PCF services

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Unanticipated policy reject scenario;PCF flagged the session for denial due to a rare rule (e.g.; blacklisted device or location) that was triggered; possibly an unintended consequence of rule logic
output: Analyze which policy rule caused the reject; confirm if it's desired or a misconfiguration; adjust the rule conditions or priority to prevent false triggers; allow session if it was an error

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: PCF not registered in NRF;PCF failed to register its NF profile (maybe after a restart) so SMF cannot discover it; certificate or config issue prevented successful registration
output: Check PCF startup logs for NRF registration status; resolve any trust or config issues; manually register PCF if needed or restart service; ensure NRF has PCF entry for discovery

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Unexpected PCF CPU spike during policy update;A bulk update of policies or a specific subscriber event caused heavy computation; PCF might be recalculating dependencies or writing to database intensively
output: If a bulk change is needed; schedule during low traffic or break into smaller chunks; monitor PCF CPU when making large updates; optimize PCF configuration to handle batch updates more efficiently

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Stale policy rule not removed;When a session ended; PCF did not send terminate for an associated rule; could be a missed notification from SMF or PCF bug leaving dangling rule
output: Check if SMF sent session termination to PCF; ensure PCF receives and processes termination events; clear the stale rule via API or restart if necessary; apply fixes to PCF event handling

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: AUSF service unreachable;Authentication service process down or crashed; container/pod not running; network issues preventing AMF from reaching AUSF
output: Restart AUSF service; check health of the container/VM; ensure connectivity on N8 interface (AMF-AUSF); if recurring; analyze logs for crash cause and apply patch

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Authentication vector not found for subscriber;UDM/ARPF did not return an auth vector (subscriber not provisioned for 5G AKA); SUPI not recognized; database entry missing or corrupted
output: Verify the subscriber is provisioned in UDM with correct credentials; if missing; provision the subscriber's authentication data; confirm SUPI/IMSI correctness; retry authentication

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: 5G-AKA synchronization failure;UE and network SQN (sequence number) out of sync; possibly UE has older/later sequence than UDM expects; repeated failed auth attempts
output: Trigger an authentication resynchronization procedure using AUTS from the UE; ensure UDM updates the sequence number; advise UE to attempt registration again after resync

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: AUSF-UDM interface error;Nudm Authentication service call from AUSF to UDM failed; UDM not responding or returned error; network connectivity issue between AUSF and UDM
output: Check UDM status and the Nudm interface (URI; reachability); verify AUSF configuration for UDM endpoint and credentials; restore connectivity or restart UDM if unresponsive

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Unsupported authentication method;UE requested EAP-TLS or other method not supported by AUSF; AUSF configured only for 5G AKA; method mismatch
output: Ensure UE is using a supported authentication method (e.g.; 5G AKA for SIM-based); if EAP-TLS needed; configure AUSF with proper certificate and EAP-TLS support; otherwise; deny with proper cause

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: AUSF high load (many concurrent authentications);Mass UE reattachments or attack causing numerous auth requests; AUSF running at capacity; potential DDoS attempt with fake IMSIs
output: Scale out AUSF instances or allocate more resources; implement rate limiting or CAPTCHA on suspect flows if possible; ensure firewall blocks obvious attack sources; for real load; add more AUSF in NRF for load balancing

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: AUSF application crash;Bug triggered by specific sequence (e.g.; rare EAP message); null pointer or exception in AUSF code; memory exhaustion from leak
output: Collect crash logs and core files; reboot AUSF to restore service; escalate to vendor with log for a fix; deploy patched version when available; ensure redundancy so AMF can switch to backup AUSF

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: SUCI decryption failure;AUSF (or integrated decryption function) cannot decrypt the SUCI to get SUPI; wrong public key used by UE or network; algorithm mismatch (e.g.; profile A vs B)
output: Verify that the correct home network public key is provisioned for SUCI decryption in the AUSF/UDM; if key was rotated; ensure UEs have updated profile; align the encryption scheme between UE and network

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Repeated authentication failures - UE barred;Multiple consecutive auth failures (wrong AKA response) leading to temporary bar of UE; could be rogue UE or wrong SIM info; security feature to prevent attacks
output: Confirm the UE's credentials (SIM) are correct and not cloned; if it's a legit UE with a sync issue; perform resync; if malicious attempts; continue to bar and investigate source

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: AUSF configuration error (algorithm profiles);Algorithms (e.g.; MILENAGE; TUAK) not configured properly in AUSF; mismatch with what UDM/HSS expects; could result in auth rejects
output: Check AUSF config for supported authentication algorithms; ensure it matches the ones configured in UDM for subscribers; correct any discrepancies and restart AUSF to apply changes

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: AUSF TLS handshake failure with AMF;Mutual TLS failure on N8 interface; certificate or cipher suite mismatch; AMF not trusting AUSF certificate
output: Verify that AUSF's certificate is valid and signed by trusted CA; ensure AMF trusts this CA; check if both sides support a common cipher; update certificates or cipher configs and retry

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: AUSF not registered in NRF;AUSF failed to register its NF profile; possibly due to service boot issue or NRF communication error; AMF might not discover it via NRF if using indirect lookup
output: Check if AUSF is listed in NRF (via NRF queries or logs); if not; trigger a reregistration of AUSF; ensure AUSF has network connectivity to NRF and correct credentials; fix any issues and confirm registration

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Auth request routing issue;AMF sent authentication request to wrong AUSF instance or an AUSF that doesn't serve that subscriber (e.g.; in multi-PLMN scenario); NRF provided an out-of-date route
output: Ensure AMF queries NRF with correct homeId if needed; verify AUSF is designated for the subscriber's home network; update NRF entries or AMF routing configuration to route to the correct AUSF

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Outdated authentication key in UDM;UDM holds an older key version than the SIM (if key was changed or SIM updated); leads to auth failure as calculations differ
output: Sync subscriber authentication information in UDM with the SIM's current credentials (K; OPC; etc.); ensure any key updates in SIMs are reflected in UDM/ARPF; reattempt authentication after sync

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Excessive AUSF logging causing slowness;Debug mode enabled on AUSF; logging every message; causing I/O bottleneck; high CPU usage on formatting logs
output: Disable or reduce logging verbosity on AUSF in production; ensure only necessary information is logged; monitor performance improvement once logging is adjusted

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: AUSF memory leak identified;Gradual memory increase after each auth request; possibly objects not freed (software bug); eventually could crash or OOM
output: Track memory usage pattern; if leak persists; plan periodic restarts or switchover in short term; implement vendor patch to fix leak; verify memory stability after fix

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Intermittent Nudm authentication failure;Occasional failures in retrieving auth data from UDM (perhaps due to UDM load or network issues); not consistent but impacting some attempts
output: Correlate failures with UDM logs; if UDM was busy or timed out; consider scaling UDM or optimizing; improve retry logic on AUSF for transient errors; ensure reliable connectivity

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Misrouted authentication request (roaming scenario);AUSF received auth request for an external subscriber (roaming) that should be handled by another AUSF/hub; incorrect configuration leads to wrong routing of roaming authentication
output: Check roaming configuration and routing of authentication (e.g.; ensure visited network forwards to home AUSF properly or uses correct roaming interface); adjust AMF or SEPP settings if applicable to route auth to the home network

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Authentication failure for 5G emergency attach;AUSF attempted normal authentication for an emergency call attach where no subscription exists; or didn't fallback to emergency keys as required
output: Ensure AUSF/AMF recognizes emergency registration and uses appropriate authentication procedure (e.g.; accept with restricted access if no auth); update configuration so emergency attaches bypass normal AUSF check if needed

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: AUSF excessive CPU usage;Compute-intensive operations (like EAP-TLS encryption or too many simultaneous authentications) maxing out CPU; no hardware acceleration for crypto enabled
output: Enable crypto acceleration (AES-NI; etc.) on AUSF hosts if available; increase CPU resources or run more AUSF instances to share load; ensure normal traffic volume is within capacity or optimize auth processes

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Timer mishandling in authentication process;AUSF or AMF not following expected timing (e.g.; AMF times out too fast waiting for auth response; AUSF internal timer mis-set); causing abort of auth
output: Review and align authentication timers in AMF and AUSF configuration with 3GPP recommendations; adjust any non-standard timer values; test again with multiple UEs to ensure timing sync

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Concurrent authentication context mix-up;If a UE sends two authentication in parallel (rare) or in quick succession (due to retransmission); AUSF might have confused contexts; a bug in context handling
output: Inspect AUSF logs for context ID issues; ensure unique handling of each auth attempt; apply software update if this concurrency issue is known; as a workaround; limit processing to one auth at a time for the same UE

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Network slice-specific authentication policy issue;AUSF/UDM have policies where certain slices require additional auth steps or attributes; and it's not applied correctly; e.g.; enterprise slice requiring triple-check; but AUSF did default
output: Check if subscriber or slice has special authentication requirements configured; update AUSF logic or policy rules to honor slice-specific authentication procedures; test on that slice to confirm resolution

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: AUSF cannot reach UDM over HTTP/2;HTTP/2 connection on NudmAuth interface not established; possibly ALPN or protocol mismatch; firewall in between blocking HTTP/2
output: Ensure both AUSF and UDM support HTTP/2 (per 3GPP SBI standards); check if any proxies or firewalls are dropping non-HTTP/1.1 traffic; allow HTTP/2 and verify TLS ALPN negotiation for the connection

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Issue with secondary authentication;For UEs requiring secondary authentication (e.g.; via NEF for application); AUSF integration not working; missing configuration or unsupported feature
output: If secondary authentication (Nausf_SeAuth) is needed (e.g.; for untrusted non-3GPP access or application layer auth); ensure AUSF is configured to handle it; update config or software to support secondary auth flows; coordinate with UE app to test

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: UDM service not available;UDM application is down or crashed; host server offline; no heartbeat from UDM instance
output: Restart UDM service or switch to standby instance; check system logs for crash indicators; restore UDM before large-scale reattach occurs; consider HA setup to avoid single point of failure

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: UDM cannot access its database;UDR (Unified Data Repository) unreachable or down; database connection error; authentication failure to DB
output: Verify UDR status (e.g.; Cassandra/Mongo); check network connectivity between UDM and UDR; ensure DB credentials are correct; recover or failover the database then reconnect

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Subscriber profile not found;UE's SUPI/IMSI not provisioned in UDM; querying wrong database or wrong identifier (e.g.; typo in IMSI); data provisioning lag
output: Confirm the subscriber identity being queried; if not in UDM; provision the subscriber's data via OSS/BSS; if data was recently added; ensure it's in correct format and location; retry the procedure after provisioning

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Outdated subscription data in UDM;Subscriber's plan or settings have changed but UDM still has old info (e.g.; old QoS or service restrictions); sync issue with provisioning system
output: Manually refresh or update the subscriber's data in UDM to the latest known values; check the provisioning pipeline for any backlog or errors; implement alerts for data sync failures

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: UDM-AUSF communication failure;AUSF's request for authentication vectors timed out or errored; Nudm service on UDM not responding; heavy load or misconfig on UDM side
output: Check Nudm Authentication logs on UDM for errors; ensure UDM is running and can handle auth requests; look at latency - if high; maybe scale UDM or allocate more resources; verify network connectivity to AUSF

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Inconsistent data across UDM replicas;Multiple UDM instances not properly synchronized (e.g.; one site has outdated data); replication delay or failure between UDR clusters; reading from stale node
output: Force a data sync between UDM/UDR nodes; check replication logs for errors; consider routing all reads/writes to a single master temporarily; resolve any conflicts and retest subscriber queries

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: UDM high latency in responses;UDM under load due to mass device registration; CPU or memory constraints; inefficient query handling (lack of indexing in DB)
output: Scale out UDM instances or add more CPU/memory to current ones; optimize database queries (add indexes or caching for frequent lookups); ensure load is distributed if multiple UDM frontends

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: UDM process crash;Bug in UDM code triggered by specific subscriber data or query; null pointer exception; out-of-memory condition
output: Obtain crash dump from UDM; restart the UDM service; engage vendor with crash logs for bugfix; if pattern known (e.g.; certain subscriber data triggers it); correct that data or avoid until fix is applied

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Malformed subscriber data causing errors;A subscriber record has an invalid format (e.g.; an unexpected NULL or out-of-range value) which UDM cannot parse or returns error on; often due to faulty provisioning input
output: Identify the problematic subscriber record (from UDM error logs); correct the data via provisioning system or manual DB edit; implement validation on data input to UDM to prevent recurrence

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: UDM configuration issue after update;After a software upgrade; some UDM config (like PLMN list or service toggles) not set correctly; new version expecting a parameter that is missing; leads to misbehavior (e.g.; not serving certain requests)
output: Review release notes for any new config requirements; update UDM configuration files accordingly; apply config changes and restart; test key procedures (auth; session setup) to ensure UDM responds correctly

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: UDM not sending subscriber info to PCF;If UDM has Nudm_SDM (Subscriber Data Management) interface and PCF requests subscriber policy data; UDM may not respond; could be that service not enabled or PCF not authorized
output: Check if UDM's service for policy data (if applicable) is running and registered in NRF; ensure PCF is authorized to query UDM; fix any config to allow PCF requests or update PCF to use local policy if design is different

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Previous registration not cleared (UE still marked registered);UDM thinks the UE is still registered (Context Retention) because deregistration info didn't reach it; e.g.; AMF crashed before notifying UDM to remove context; affects re-registration attempts
output: Manually remove or update the UE's registration status in UDM via Nudm or O&M command; ensure future deregistration messages are reliably sent from AMF (maybe increase reliability or duplicate messaging); if AMF fail; consider periodic sweep in UDM to clean stale registrations

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Missing slice authorization data;Subscriber profile in UDM lacks slice-specific access info; so AMF/NSSF cannot verify if UE can use a slice; result may be slice selection failure
output: Update the subscriber's UDM profile with proper S-NSSAI authorization (allowed slices list); double-check format and values; propagate the update to active UDM instances; attempt registration again

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Nudm HTTP error (e.g.; 500) returned to NF;UDM encountered an unexpected condition processing a request (could be internal null pointer or DB issue) and returned server error; NF (AMF/SMF) gets 5xx
output: Examine UDM internal logs for the 500 error trigger; address underlying issue (like fix data or bug); implement error handling improvements; in short term; NF may retry or use backup UDM instance

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: UDM certificate or security issue;UDM's TLS certificate expired or not trusted by requesting NF (AMF/SMF/AUSF); or UDM requires OAuth token but NF not providing it (authorization misconfig)
output: Renew UDM's TLS certificate and distribute new CA to NFs; if using OAuth; ensure tokens are configured and NFs have valid credentials; test secure connection handshake after fixes

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: UDM excessive logging mode enabled;Debug logging turned on; causing performance degradation or disk filling; UDM spends time writing verbose logs for each request
output: Turn off or reduce UDM log verbosity to normal levels; clear out or archive old logs to free up disk; monitor performance improvement and ensure logs not needed for current troubleshooting are off

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Interworking data not updated (EPS fallback issues);In networks supporting EPS fallback; UDM not updating or retrieving the EPS (4G) context (like old GUTI) properly; could cause attach issues when falling back to LTE
output: Verify that UDM's interworking function (if any for EPS fallback) is enabled and configured; ensure the N26 interface (AMF to MME via UDM or direct) is working; update UDM software if known bug affecting context transfer

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: High DB CPU utilization impacting UDM;UDR database CPU or IO is maxed (due to heavy queries or compactions); causing slow response to UDM queries; possibly due to a large number of subscribers being accessed at once
output: Optimize database performance: add indexes; upgrade hardware; or scale out DB nodes; schedule heavy operations (backups; compactions) in off-peak times; ensure UDM/UDR cluster is appropriately sized for subscriber count

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Network connectivity issue to UDM;AMF/SMF cannot reach UDM due to a network partition or misrouting; perhaps after network maintenance; route to UDM changed or firewall closed
output: Perform connectivity tests (ping/traceroute) from NF to UDM; update routing tables or DNS if IP changed; open necessary firewall ports; in interim; if multiple UDM; try a reachable instance

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: UDM license limit reached;UDM handling more subscribers or transactions than the licensed capacity; license enforcement triggered limiting service
output: Review UDM license to see allowed capacity; if exceeded; contact vendor to extend license; implement short-term load reduction (throttle new attach attempts) if possible to stabilize; plan for capacity upgrade

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Data corruption detected in UDR;UDM got an unexpected value or checksum error reading from UDR; possible data corruption or partial write in the database; could be from prior crash or storage issue
output: Identify any corrupted records (via DB logs or UDM error output); restore from backup if available for those entries; run consistency check tools on UDR; consider a brief outage to repair DB if needed

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Slow subscriber data provisioning interface;When updating subscriber info from OSS/BSS into UDM; the interface is slow or backlog built up; possibly due to heavy load or network issues between OSS and UDM
output: Coordinate with IT/OSS team to check the provisioning queue; increase throughput of provisioning by optimizing batch size or frequency; ensure UDM has resources to handle provisioning in parallel with live queries

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Unexpected UDM high memory usage;Large volume of subscriber data loaded into memory (cache) and not released; memory leak or oversized cache; possibly due to handling of a very large subscriber profile or many simultaneous requests
output: Tune UDM memory settings (cache size limits); if leak suspected; restart UDM periodically while investigating; update to a version with memory optimizations; break large requests into smaller ones if applicable

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Authentication vector generation failure;UDM's authentication function (ARPF) failed to compute a vector; possibly due to corrupted key or unsupported algorithm configured for subscriber
output: Verify the subscriber's authentication data (K; OP/OPc) in UDM/ARPF; ensure the correct algorithm (Milenage; etc.) is in use; if key is corrupted or unknown; re-provision subscriber credentials; test generation again

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Subscriber inadvertently marked as deregistered;A glitch or admin error caused UDM to mark an active subscriber as deregistered (or inactive); perhaps during data cleanup or sync; an active entry was removed
output: Cross-check subscriber status with AMF; if UDM incorrectly shows deregistered; manually update status or have UE reattach; adjust procedures to prevent accidental de-provisioning; restore from logs/backups if needed

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NSSF service offline;NSSF container or process is down; not running due to crash or config error; AMF slice queries time out
output: Restart the NSSF service; check for core dumps or error logs for cause of failure; ensure a secondary NSSF is available for redundancy; monitor for stability after restart

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Slice configuration not found;Requested S-NSSAI (slice ID) is not configured in NSSF database; perhaps new slice not added or typo in slice identifier; NSSF returns no slice available
output: Verify that the S-NSSAI is configured in the NSSF slice list; add the missing slice details (including mapping to core NFs) to NSSF config; update and reload NSSF; retry registration with correct slice info

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Incorrect slice selection outcome;NSSF provided a slice or network recommendation that is not suitable (e.g.; directs to wrong SMF or area); mapping rules mis-configured; outdated network information
output: Review NSSF mapping rules for slice selection; correct any erroneous mapping entries (like wrong AMF or SMF for a slice); update NSSF's network topology data; test slice selection again

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NSSF-NRF communication failure;NSSF cannot query NRF for NF (like candidate AMFs/SMFs) due to connectivity issues or NRF being down; TLS/credential issues between NSSF and NRF
output: Check that NRF is reachable and healthy; verify NSSF's NRF endpoint config and credentials; re-establish connection (check for certificate validity); ensure NSSF can fetch NF profiles from NRF after fix

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NSSF heavy load (overload);Surge in slice selection requests (e.g.; many UEs attaching concurrently across slices); NSSF running on limited resources; possibly a misbehaving AMF repeatedly querying
output: Scale out NSSF or increase resources; implement caching of slice recommendations for identical requests to reduce load; check if any AMF is looping requests and fix its behavior; apply load-shedding policy if needed

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NSSF returned incomplete slice info;NSSF responded but missing some elements (e.g.; only slice ID without suggested AMF/SMF info) due to partial config; might confuse the AMF; possibly a bug or misconfig in response template
output: Examine NSSF configuration and output format; ensure that for each slice query; necessary info (allowed NSSAI; preferred NFs; etc.) are fully provided; update NSSF software if a known bug causes incomplete responses

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: Subscriber not authorized for any slice;NSSF (using UDM data or config) determined UE has no allowed slices (e.g.; corporate UE trying public slice with no permission); results in registration reject
output: Verify subscriber's allowed slice list in UDM and NSSF; update the profile to include needed slices if this is a provisioning error; if intentional; ensure correct reject cause is sent; otherwise; provide at least a default slice

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: All slice resources at capacity;NSSF finds that the targeted slice is at capacity (all AMFs/SMFs for that slice are overloaded or no free PDU sessions); policy configured to not accept more UEs on that slice
output: Either increase capacity for that slice (deploy more core instances for the slice); or adjust NSSF policy to allow spillover to another slice if possible; communicate to subscriber if service is limited

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NSSF configuration sync issue;If multiple NSSF instances are used (e.g.; per region); their configurations differ; one has updated slice info; another does not; leading to inconsistent decisions
output: Synchronize NSSF configuration across all instances (e.g.; through common config management or database); if using distributed deployment; ensure changes propagate; perform tests from different regions to confirm consistency

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NSSF not updated after network changes;Core network topology changed (new AMF/SMF added or removed; slice coverage changed) but NSSF config was not updated; NSSF still giving out old info (like recommending a removed NF)
output: Update NSSF with the latest network configuration and NF lists (maybe via automated OAM update); remove any decommissioned NF references; after update; verify NSSF suggestions align with actual network setup

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
input: NSSF certificate expired;Security certificate used for NSSF's SBI communication expired; AMF/NRF refusing connections from NSSF; secure requests failing handshake
output: Renew NSSF's certificate and ensure it's signed by a CA trusted by NRF/peers; update certificate on NSSF and restart; confirm that AMF and NRF accept connections post-renewal

instruction: As a 5G mobile network engineer resolve the following issues
